title: (x) "Stormspell" Gothic-looking logo - hand drawn {Lex}
content:
any ideas? looking for something close that I can tweak.

Thanks,  
JC (newbie)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/typophile.com/files/font_90.jpg) | 40.59 KB |

 [‹ Font of Sagmeister's new book](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43935 "Go to previous forum topic") [Print Magazine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43928 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jaaseee

comments.content: please help ID this font for me.

This is custom designed. None of the repeating letters are the same.

- Lex

P.S. I know we’re fast, but if you don’t receive a response within a minute, wait a few more :-)

Indeed hand drawn, not a font. Neighboring territory: [Elsewhere](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/comicraft/elsewhere_regular_ot/?sample_text=StormspelL&sample_size=96)

wow, that was fast! Thanks, I should have caught that it was done by hand.

SC Elsewhere? hmmm

I guess I’ll pose another question in this thread just to keep it simple...

What is the most authentic route to go when doing this style of lettering? Is this Celtic in origin?

ty,  
JC
You might also enjoy something from [Margo Chase](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/person/chase/margo/).

You could try [http://www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705161149/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "http://www.letterheadfonts.com") - I feel sure you’ll find something appropriate there.

JH

In Judith Schalansky’s “Fraktur Mon Amour” I found “Haunted” - it came with the book’s bonus CD. I’d love to include a picture but although I have studied the forum’s guidelines I seem not to be able to upload it - the appropriate box does not show on my browser.

Anyway, the font’s home is moorstation.org/typoasis
